org.azeckoski.reflectutils.transcoders
Class JSONTranscoder

java.lang.Object
  org.azeckoski.reflectutils.transcoders.JSONTranscoder
All Implemented Interfaces:
Transcoder
public class JSONTranscoder
extends Object
implements Transcoder

Provides methods for encoding and decoding JSON

Author:
Aaron Zeckoski (azeckoski @ gmail.com)

Nested Class Summary
 class JSONTranscoder.JsonReader
          Create Java objects from JSON (note that only simple java objects, maps, and arrays will be returned)
Dates will come back in as UTC timecodes or possibly strings which you will need to parse manually
Numbers will come in as int if they are small, long if they are big, and BigInteger if they are huge, floating point is handled similarly: float, double, BigDecimal
JSON arrays come back as a List always, similarly, any collection or array that was output will come back as a list
You can use the ConversionUtils to help with conversion if needed
Derived from code at: https://svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/stringtree/trunk/src/delivery/java/org/stringtree/json/JSONWriter.java

Constructor Detail

JSONTranscoder

public JSONTranscoder()
Default constructor: See other constructors for options

JSONTranscoder

public JSONTranscoder(boolean humanOutput,
                      boolean includeNulls,
                      boolean includeClassField)
Parameters:
humanOutput - if true then enable human readable output (includes indentation and line breaks)
includeNulls - if true then create output tags for null values
includeClassField - if true then include the value from the "getClass()" method as "class" when encoding beans and maps
Method Detail

getHandledFormat

public String getHandledFormat()
Specified by:
getHandledFormat in interface Transcoder
Returns:
the handled format (xml, json, etc.)

encode

public String encode(Object object,
                     String name,
                     Map<String,Object> properties)
Specified by:
encode in interface Transcoder
Parameters:
object - any java object (should not be null)
name - (optional) the name of the data, will be handled differently by the encoders (null for default: Transcoder.DATA_KEY)
properties - (optional) additional properties which will be added to the encoding as if it were a property of the bean or map being encoded, if the object being encoded is not a bean or a map then the properties are ignored
Returns:
the object encoded into the handled format

decode

public Map<String,Object> decode(String string)
Description copied from interface: Transcoder
Decode the data string into a map of java objects (typically simple objects like String, Integer, etc.)

Specified by:
decode in interface Transcoder
Parameters:
string - a string in the handled format
Returns:
the map of java objects based on the data string, this will not attempt to convert XML into beans but will simply convert data into maps or lists or simple java objects (strings, etc.), if there is only a single simple value then it will be placed into the map with the key "data"

setMaxLevel

public void setMaxLevel(int maxLevel)
Parameters:
maxLevel - the number of objects to follow when traveling through the object, 0 means only the fields in the initial object, default is 7

makeJSON

public static String makeJSON(Object object)
Convert an object into a well-formed, element-normal XML string.

Parameters:
object - any object
Returns:
the JSON string version of the object

makeJSON

public static String makeJSON(Object object,
                              Map<String,Object> properties,
                              boolean humanOutput,
                              boolean includeNulls,
                              boolean includeClassField,
                              int maxLevel)
Convert an object into a well-formed, element-normal XML string.

Parameters:
object - any object
humanOutput - true of human readable output
includeNulls - true to include null values when generating tags
includeClassField - if true then include the value from the "getClass()" method as "class" when encoding beans and maps
maxLevel - TODO
Returns:
the JSON string version of the object
